description.originalText: Bea is exceptional!! She came into my friend’s family at a very overwhelming and sad time when my friend had just passed away. She became the rock for her kids and for all of us. She kept the household in tact and brought much needed stability to us all. I don’t know what we would have done without her. She is an excellent cook, great with kids and adults alike, and keeps a very clean house. She comes highly recommended. Anybody would be so lucky to have her!

I hired Maria two weeks after my wife died.  I have three children who were 9, 16, and 18 at the time.  My 18 year old is severely autistic.  Maria showed incredible  sensitivity and understanding not just through the immediate grieving period, but for the long term.  She cultivated a bond with the children, while at the same time was able to make them understand the need for good behavior, manners, and order in the house.  Maria did everything for us.  She ran all aspects of my household so that i could leave for work at 5am and return at 7pm.  Maria even stayed and took care of everybody and everything when I had to travel and be gone for 3-4 days at a time.  I trust Maria with the safety and well-being of my children.  I give her the highest compliment possible!

I hired Bea B, to work as a nanny in my home 5 years ago, and I would certainly recommend her work. Bea has demonstrated tremendous responsibility in taking care of our children and in keeping the house in working order. She is kind, trustworthy and great with children.
It is clear to me that working as a nanny is a passion for Bea . She loves working with the children, and I see this manifest in her communication skills and creative ideas for activities. She keeps the children occupied and most importantly, safe. 
Ultimately, Bea is an excellent nanny because she is so trustworthy. She is always on-time and held to high responsibility. My family has never known her not to be forthcoming and honest. 
Sincerely, 
Margaret F

description.displayText: I have two girls 20 months apart in age.  Maria started with me when my youngest was around 11 months.  She stayed with us until the youngest was about 12 or 13 and we did not need full-time help. The girls love Maria and still keep in touch with her.  They are now 17 and 19.  I work full time and Maria made it possible.  She is helpful and responsible and takes the job seriously.  She was always there.  And, she loves the girls.  I would be happy to speak to anyone and provide the details and answer any questions.

description.displayText:
Maria "Bea" has been our live-in nanny (Monday through Friday) for the last four years, caring for our two daughters, now ages 5 and 7.5.  She began working for us in 2012, when our youngest daughter was 10 months old and our older daughter was in pre-school.

Bea is adept at handling daily childcare responsibilities, such as dressing and feeding the children, taking them to school, bathing them, cleaning-up their rooms and play areas, laundry, getting the children ready for bed, etc.   She has also been wonderful at scheduling play dates for our children.  Both of our children are involved in many after school activities and Bea has done a great job in juggling carpooling schedules and always making sure the girls arrive to and are picked up from their activities on time.  Most importantly, Bea has always been very loving to our daughters.       

My job often requires late hours on short notice or out of town travel and Bea has always been flexible about working with our schedule. She is extremely reliable and we trust her implicitly.  She has driven my car (large SUV) the entire time she has worked for us and she is an extremely safe driver.  I not only trust her to drive my children anywhere and in any type of weather conditions, but all of my friends trust Bea to drive their children.  

I highly recommend Bea to care for your children.
